paper_abstract: Let G=(VG,AG) be a digraph and let S aS" T be a bipartition of VG. A bibranching is a subset BaS dagger AG such that for each node saS there exists a directed s-T path in B and, vice versa, for each node taT there exists a directed S-t path in B. Bibranchings generalize both branchings and bipartite edge covers. Keijsper and Pendavingh proposed a strongly polynomial primal-dual algorithm that finds a minimum weight bibranching in O(n'(m+nlog n)) time (where n:=|VG|, m:=|AG|, n':=min (|S|,|T|)). Assuming that arc weights are integers we develop a weight-scaling algorithm of time complexity O(m root n log n log(nW)) for the minimum weight bibranching problem (where W denotes the maximum magnitude of arc weights).
paper_title: An Efficient Scaling Algorithm for the Minimum Weight Bibranching Problem
